Art 104

Final Project

Generative Art, Created in Disco Diffusion, artist unknown: Link To Art © artists retain copyright

AI Generated... Art?

Ian Tyson

//

// yourwebsite.com //

Abstract

AI generated art History & definition What is AI generated art? how does it “create” When did it begin? How its made Programs Images vs. Videos Relevance Art created by machines shows possibilities Begs questions of creativity vs algorithms AI art vs Human-made art Is this art? My interpretations Aesthetic relations to Monet and Surrealism “Garden of Earth Delights” Hieronymus Bosch Space, Religious art, hypnotism, Lovecraft AI art is emerging in popularity, especially with the ease of access to programs and it’s demand in the NFT field. The work exists strictly in the digital realm (except of course it the image has been printed) and can be seen in both video and static forms. What is interesting, however, is if these images should be considered art? After all, the art is simply created BY a computer but with the guidance of a human being. Most of the pieces reflect styles that are reminiscent of surrealism: dreamlike scenes and states. What I find fascinating about AI art is how you can forever explore the pieces and how the works are almost like a psychedelic monet - they look clear from afar but as you zoom in, your mind cannot make sense of the imagery. I love the aesthetics we see in AI art, some of which being: religious, ethereal, space/nebulous, and Lovecraftian forms.
